byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Grayson, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. John Mura contributed reporting from Grayson, and Alan Rappeport from Washington.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Rowan County, Ky, clerk Kim Davis, is released amid cheers from supporters after spending five days in jail for refusing to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples; declines to say whether she will keep defying court orders and attempt to block licenses.
lead_paragraph: The Rowan County clerk, who was held in contempt for defying a court order to issue the licenses to same-sex couples, was ordered freed.

headline.main: Kim Davis, Released From Kentucky Jail, Won’t Say if She Will Keep Defying Court
headline.print_headline: Released Kentucky Clerk Won’t Say if She Will Continue to Defy Court

snippet: The Rowan County clerk, who was held in contempt for defying a court order to issue the licenses to same-sex couples, was ordered freed.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
